How can I retrieve information about a specific transaction using the `curl` command and JSON-RPC?

You can retrieve information about a specific transaction using the `curl` command and JSON-RPC by sending a POST request to the Verus JSON-RPC server. The basic syntax is:
```
curl --user <username> --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "gettransaction", "params": ["<transaction_id>"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace `<username>` with your Verus username and `<transaction_id>` with the ID of the transaction you want to retrieve information about. For example:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "gettransaction", "params": ["1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
This will return information about the specified transaction in JSON format.

Examples: > verus gettransaction "1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d" > verus gettransaction "1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d" true > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "gettransaction", "params": ["1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
